p:
The clonal populations serving as source material for the essential oils includes two new and unique Rutgers University catnip cultivars N. cataria cv. ‘CR3’ and N. cataria cv. ‘CR9’ both stable in unique essential oil chemistry, promising growth characteristics and high essential oil yields
40 . The CR3 essential oil chemotype is mainly comprised of the E, Z-nepetalactone isomer yet also produces Z, E-nepetalactone. The CR9 essential oil chemotype is dominated by the Z, E-nepetalactone isomer and produces little E, Z-nepetalactone. The hydro-distilled essential oil from these two populations served as the source for the crude essential oil treatments and partitioned for subsequent fractionation and nepetalactone purification.
